results.title: Playing the miles away
results.creator_credit: Film Academy and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Playing the game (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Thinking”.
Final in the series. Shows the children’s attitudes to rules and conventions of behaviour, showing recognition of the need and adoption of their own rules for games as authoritative.

results.title: Playground Discipline: A Positive Approach (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Playground disruption is a fact of life in the school world, but it can be successfully managed. This film demonstrates how to select and train older students to handle most of the conflicts that occur daily on the playground.

results.title: Playground
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
The playground provides an opportunity for the child to develop his motor skills. Children are seen in this environment responding to the challenges of obstacles and play things.

results.title: Playful Pluto [silent] [edited version]
results.creator_credit: Joseph Schenck and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon starring Mickey Mouse and Pluto. A series of wacky slapstick comedy scenes as Pluto leads Mickey from one catastrophe to the next, all stemming from a fight with the hose in the backyard.

results.title: Players
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Kratky Film and John Halas
results.brief_description: An animated satire on aggression. Two characters, who look like two famous tennis players play a game of tennis which gradually develops into a battle. (Award: Special Jury Prize, Montreal World Film Festival, 1982)
